SCJ adds protection for youth defendants' cases

By upholding a Lynn teenager's dismissed murder case, the state's highest court set forth new law to notify grand juries when a teenager will be tried as an adult. (Globe)
  • 11/19 Mass. moving slowly on fate of juvenile killers
  • crime & punishment Life without parole right for some
  • 6/26 SCOTUS: No mandatory life for juveniles  |  Discuss

Former Bruin Jonathan facing jail time

Stan Jonathan could receive four years in prison stemming from the November shooting death of another hunter in Canada, resulting in Jonathan's charge of criminal negligence causing death. (Globe)
  • 11/15 Ex-Bruin Jonathan charged in shooting  |  Discuss

Higher earning: College presidents' pay

All of these folks have a right to smile for teaching our next crop of leaders. But, like their pay, some smiles are bigger than others. See what those in the Bay State earn.
  • Highest-paid US college presidents | Where they live
  • 12/9 Pay increases for some college heads in Mass.

UMass pairs med students with patients

A University of Mass. Medical School student and an 8-year-old, who have both had kidney transplants, connected through an initiative called Sidekicks. They're also friends. (Globe)
  • watch You've got a friend: Sidekicks program thrives

Cape Cod train set to roll by summer

A new weekend-only train between South Station and Hyannis, called CapeFLYER, starts next May, and will be the first train service to the Cape in 25 years. (Globe)
